verses.text: 我看見日光之下有一件憾事，重壓在世人身上。

words.definition: under the sun, in the world
words.note: A common phrase in Ecclesiastes referring to earthly existence.
Often used metaphorically for 'upon someone' or 'on their shoulders'.

verses.text: 蒙 神賜予財富、資產和榮譽的人，心裡所願的，都一無所缺，可是 神使他無力享用，反而有外人來享用。這是虛空，也是禍患。

words.note: Often used in formal or religious contexts for receiving grace or favor.

words.definition: particle before verb forming nominal phrase

words.note: A key theme in Ecclesiastes, often translated as 'vanity'.

verses.text: 人如果生下百子，活了許多歲數，年日長久，但是心裡不因美物滿足，又得不到安葬，我以為流產的胎比他還好。

words.note: Used idiomatically to mean a large number of children.

verses.text: 因為這胎虛虛而來，暗暗而去，黑暗把他的名字遮蔽了。

words.note: Describes something arriving without substance or purpose.
Describes something departing unseen or without recognition.

verses.text: 這胎既看不見天日，又一無所知，就比那人更得安息。

words.note: Refers to the light of day, or metaphorically, life in the world.
Often refers to eternal rest or a state of peace.

verses.text: 那人即使活了一千年，再活一千年，也享受不到甚麼；他們兩者不是都歸一個地方嗎？

words.note: Used as a resultative complement here.

verses.text: 人的一切勞碌都為口腹，他的心卻還是填不滿。

words.note: Often implies burdensome labor in biblical context.
Lit. 'mouth and belly'; refers to basic bodily needs.

verses.text: 智慧人比愚昧人有甚麼長處呢？窮人在眾人面前知道怎樣行事為人，又有甚麼長處呢？

words.note: 智慧 (wisdom) is a key concept in Ecclesiastes.
愚昧 (folly) is a key concept in Ecclesiastes.
Idiomatic phrase for how one lives their life, often with moral undertone.

verses.text: 眼睛看見的，勝過心中想望的。這也是虛空，也是捕風。

words.note: Implies a deep longing or yearning, often spiritual.
A central theme and recurring word in Ecclesiastes.
An idiom in Ecclesiastes meaning a futile effort.

verses.text: 已經存在的，早已有了名稱；大家都知道人是怎樣的；人絕對無法與比自己強的抗辯。
verses.heading: The Futile Way Life Works

verses.text: 因為話語增多，虛空也增多，這對人有甚麼益處呢？

words.note: A key theme in Ecclesiastes, often translated as 'vanity of vanities'.

verses.text: 在虛空、消逝如影的人生，短暫的日子裡，有誰知道甚麼是對人有益處呢？誰能告訴人他死後在日光之下會發生甚麼事呢？

words.note: Often used with '在...裡' to indicate location or time frame.

words.definition: under the sun, in this world
words.note: A frequent phrase in Ecclesiastes, referring to earthly existence.
